timeline.bodyText:
I wonder if we really need this. In general, the operator would be waiting the operation timeout several times:

for Zoo pods
for Kafka pods
for EO pod
for KE pod
for CC pod

In the code you seem to take the 3 as one block valid for single TIMEOUT_FOR_RESOURCE_READINESS. And then for some reason you think the KE and CC pods are worth each TIMEOUT_FOR_RESOURCE_READINESS again.
If you think it is needed I'm fine with it. But it seems a bit weird why should KE and CC get this special treatment.
timeline.author: scholzj

replies.bodyText:
I have there TIMEOUT_FOR_RESOURCE_CREATION and that's like 5 minutes. So the whole Kafka CR -> ZK, Kafka, EO - will have 14 minutes to be ready. If we set up KE or CC it will get +5minutes to whole timeout ... how I mentioned in description, it's only prerequisite and I'll change to proper time (3-5 minutes) in next PR, don't want to make a mess in our Constants.
Is it OK this way?
replies.author: im-konge

replies.bodyText: And I hope that KE and CC will get up sooner than in 5 minutes. But, we know our race conditions.
replies.author: im-konge

replies.bodyText: Ok, I guess that makes more sense.
replies.author: scholzj
